spanishExample: Si quieres aprender mucho, tienes que viajar.
englishTranslation: If you want to learn a lot, you have to travel.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Desayuné café fresco.
englishTranslation: I had fresh coffee for breakfast.
vocabIncluded: desayuné: had breakfast, I had breakfast  (desayunar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Si pones la comida en la nevera, va a estar fría.
englishTranslation: If you put the food in the fridge, it’s going to be cold.
vocabIncluded: pones: put, you put (Poner, present, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Desayunan juntos, pero cenan solos.
englishTranslation: They have breakfast together, but have dinner alone.
vocabIncluded: cenan: have dinner, they have dinner (Cenar, present, 3rd person plural)
desayunan: have breakfast, they have breakfast (desayunar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Escribió la carta en papel violeta.
englishTranslation: She wrote the letter on purple paper.
vocabIncluded: escribió: wrote, he/she/it wrote (escribir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No cena a menos que la mesa esté limpia.
englishTranslation: She doesn’t have dinner unless the table is clean.
vocabIncluded: cena: has dinner, he/she/it has dinner (Cenar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Cenó algo barato.
englishTranslation: He had something cheap for dinner.
vocabIncluded: cenó: had dinner, he/she/it had dinner(Cenar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Almorzaron lo que estaba en el refrigerador.
englishTranslation: They had for lunch what was in the refrigerator.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
almorzaron: had lunch, they had lunch (Almorzar, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No quiere leer lo que has escrito.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t want to read what you have written.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Toma el rosa, está limpio.
englishTranslation: Take the pink one(m), it’s clean.

spanishExample: Está leyendo en la cocina.
englishTranslation: She’s reading in the kitchen.

spanishExample: Mi amigo viaja y aprende mucho.
englishTranslation: My friend travels and learns a lot.
vocabIncluded: aprende: learns, he/she/it learns (aprender, present, 3rd person)
viaja: travels, he/she/it travels (Viajar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La comida ya está tibia y no quiero que esté fría.
englishTranslation: The food is already lukewarm and I don’t want it to be cold.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Aprende a almorzar en casa; es más barato.
englishTranslation: Learn how to have lunch at home; it’s cheaper.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)

spanishExample: Viajan todas las semanas y almuerzan ahí.
englishTranslation: They travel every week and have lunch there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
almuerzan: have lunch, they have lunch (Almorzar, present, 3rd person plural)
viajan: travel, they travel  (Viajar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: El inodoro en su apartamento es gris.
englishTranslation: The toilet in his apartment is gray.

spanishExample: Si desayuna ahí, puede usar la ducha.
englishTranslation: If he has breakfast there, he can use the shower.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
desayuna: has breakfast, he/she/it has breakfast  (desayunar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Nunca usamos esos muebles para cenar.
englishTranslation: We never use that furniture to have dinner.
vocabIncluded: para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive
usamos: use, we use (Usar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Cenamos con nuestros amigos en el comedor los viernes.
englishTranslation: We have dinner with our friends in the dining room on Fridays.
vocabIncluded: cenamos: have dinner, we have dinner (Cenar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Te veré en el edificio antiguo y amarillo.
englishTranslation: I’ll see you at the old yellow building.
vocabIncluded: veré: will see, I will see (Ver, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Tienes que andar despacio, porque el piso está mojado.
englishTranslation: You have to walk slowly, because the floor is wet.
vocabIncluded: andar: to walk / to go/get along (Andar infinitive)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Solo lee historias cortas sentada en el sofá.
englishTranslation: She only reads short stories sitting on the couch.
vocabIncluded: lee: reads, he/she/it reads (Leer, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Almorcé con él cuando estaba viajando.
englishTranslation: I had lunch with him when I was traveling.

spanishExample: Solo escribe en su escritorio.
englishTranslation: He only writes at his desk.
vocabIncluded: escribe: writes, he/she/it writes (escribir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tiene que escribir sobre su hogar.
englishTranslation: She has to write about her home.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: He viajado mucho y aprendí cosas diferentes.
englishTranslation: I have traveled a lot and I learned different things.
vocabIncluded: aprendí: learned, I learned (aprender, preterite, 1st person)
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Desayuno en la cocina en mi departamento.
englishTranslation: I have breakfast in the kitchen at my flat.
vocabIncluded: desayuno: have breakfast, I have breakfast (desayunar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Por favor, usa el lavamanos antes de desayunar.
englishTranslation: Please, use the sink before having breakfast.

spanishExample: La bañera es ancha y marrón; no me gusta.
englishTranslation: The bathtub is wide and brown; I don’t like it.
vocabIncluded: gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Escríbele una carta cuando viajes.
englishTranslation: Write him a letter when you travel.
vocabIncluded: le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: El armario es estrecho y corto, no puedo poner ropa ahí.
englishTranslation: The wardrobe is narrow and short; I can’t put clothes there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener

spanishExample: Leí el libro despacio para poder entenderlo.
englishTranslation: I read(past) the book slowly to be able to understand it.
vocabIncluded: leí: read, I read (Leer, preterite, 1st person)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Ella quiere que yo viaje ahí, pero mi auto es lento.
englishTranslation: She wants me to travel there, but my car is slow.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
viaje: travel, I travel (Viajar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Leo el mismo libro que lees.
englishTranslation: I’m reading the same book that you’re reading.
vocabIncluded: lees: read, you read (Leer, present, 2nd person)
leo: read, I read (Leer, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: La comida fue cara, pero al menos está caliente.
englishTranslation: The food was expensive, but at least it’s hot.

spanishExample: El alquiler del departamento es demasiado caro.
englishTranslation: The rent of the flat is too expensive.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Lee lo que escribí y dime si te gusta.
englishTranslation: Read what I wrote and tell me if you like it.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
escribí: wrote, I wrote (escribir, preterite, 1st person)
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: ¿Aprendiste cómo llegar al apartamento?
englishTranslation: Did you learn how to get to the apartment?
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
aprendiste: learned , you learned (aprender, preterite, 2nd person)
cómo: adverb meaning "how?" in a question or implied question

spanishExample: No lo he leído, así que no lo he aprendido aún.
englishTranslation: I haven’t read it, so I haven’t learned it yet.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No quiero que mi hogar esté sucio.
englishTranslation: I don’t want my home to be dirty.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: La comida está seca; necesito algo para tomar.
englishTranslation: The food is dry; I need something to drink.
vocabIncluded: necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive
